function_call.name: get_risks
function_call.arguments: {"risks":[{"Description":"Real-time updates and dynamic content may encourage user interaction but also increase the risk of contagious disease propagation if the dashboard is accessed by infected individuals.","Impact":"Potential spread of contagious diseases within the built environment if infected individuals interact with the dashboard.","Mitigation":"Implement strict hygiene protocols for users accessing the dashboard, including hand sanitization and regular cleaning of shared devices.","Technologies":"Usage of touchless interfaces, voice commands, and sensor-based interaction to reduce physical contact with the dashboard.","People":"Building operators, sustainability managers, and other end-users of the dashboard.","Owner":"Building management and system administrators."},{"Description":"Limited availability of historical data through the dashboard may hinder comprehensive analysis of building performance, including the tracking of long-term trends and patterns in indoor environmental quality.","Impact":"Inability to identify prolonged indoor environmental quality issues and address them effectively, leading to potential health risks and decreased occupant satisfaction.","Mitigation":"Implementation of a secure and user-friendly system for accessing archival data, with appropriate access controls and data visualization tools for comprehensive analysis.","Technologies":"Cloud-based storage solutions and data visualization software for efficient access and analysis of historical data.","People":"Researchers, building performance analysts, and facility management personnel.","Owner":"Building management and system administrators."},{"Description":"Automatic generation and distribution of weekly reports may lead to complacency among users in conducting their own detailed follow-up diagnostics, potentially overlooking critical issues in indoor environmental quality.","Impact":"Missed opportunities for timely identification and resolution of indoor environmental quality problems, resulting in prolonged exposure to unhealthy conditions for building occupants.","Mitigation":"Implement regular education and training programs for users to emphasize the importance of conducting detailed follow-up diagnostics despite the availability of weekly summaries. Encourage proactive engagement with the dashboard beyond the weekly reports.","Technologies":"Data analytics tools for user-specific trend analysis and anomaly detection, coupled with interactive training modules for users.","People":"Building operators, sustainability managers, and other end-users of the dashboard.","Owner":"Building management and system administrators."}]}
